location.name: New York, New York, United States

title: Analyst
content:
About You
You’re curious, organized, methodical, and proactive. You like to use substantiated data to both identify and solve problems, rather than trust your gut alone.
As the core team of global communications powerhouse Weber Shandwick, we are leveraging bleeding edge data science approaches and development tools to provide unparalleled access to unexplored insights derived from the world’s most important digital, social and e-commerce platforms.
Our clients span five continents, and their consumers are everywhere. The systems and tools we are designing will be one of a kind and unique in their value to meet the global marketplace's current and future needs. 
We Are Seeking
We are seeking a strategic thinker with a strong analytical mind to help pulling and analyzing data, and extracting deep insights using the systems and tools we are designing in-house. You will be able to leverage data to uncover insights and tell compelling stories. 
The Analyst will join the Chicago Analytics + Intelligence team, Weber Shandwick’s Analytics Function, to focus on delivering impactful analytics insights and strategy that is core to the marketing and communications of our clients.
The position will directly report to and work with the Chicago office but may support teams across all North American practice areas. This position will be dedicated to several of Weber Shandwick’s largest and most important client relationships.
What You Will Be Doing

Lead day-to-day project delivery, coordinating with clients and the rest of your Weber Shandwick teammates to establish partnerships and prove value/ROI, infusing all aspects of the work with data-driven insights and measurement.
Work with Analytics + Intelligence teammates to create visually compelling reporting and actionable insights that allow clients to easily evaluate communications, media and/or site performance relative to business objectives.
Team up with data scientists and senior intelligence leads to design and develop analyses, identifying and articulating insights and building narratives that move internal and external audiences to act on our recommendations.
Evangelize the use of data to inform decision-making at all levels internally and externally.
Interrogate multiple sources of information/data to look for trends within social and earned media, using tools such as Talkwalker, Quid, and Trendkite.
Fully utilize tools and platforms designed to automate and accelerate data collection, integration and analysis. Examples: Google Analytics, Domo, Google Data Studio, Tableau, etc.
Leverage a variety of descriptive and inferential statistical methods to analyze data from multiple online sources.
Manage reporting tasks and data flows for media, site and social listening insights and reporting.
Educate non-technical account team members on key requests and analysis process.
Manage and build relationships with clients and internal account management teams.
Participate in business development activities, including scope design, strategic analysis, slide preparation and work planning.

Basic Qualifications­­­­­

Strong interest and capacity to translate data and research into strategic insights and recommendations.
Passion for working with data and deriving insights to answer client business questions.
Familiarity with social listening, media analytics and measurement.
Ability to work independently and in an integrated team setting.
Strong communication (written and presentation) skills.
Commitment to learning and the drive to take initiative.
Strong critical thinking skills, organizational skills and attention to detail.
Bachelor’s degree with major in business or STEM preferred, Masters is a plus.
1-3 years relevant full-time experience; preferably in Marketing Analytics, Marketing Science, Data Science or Performance Marketing fields.
Experience with social listening tools such as Quid, Brandwatch, TalkWalker, Netbase, Sprinklr and Trendkite is a plus.
Experience with data visualization tools including but not limited to: Tableau, Google Data Studio, Domo, Excel, etc.
Able to leverage scripting to automate analyses, data cleansing or data integration tasks.
Experience with relational databases and statistical analysis/programming languages such as SAS, SQL, R or Python is a plus.
Comfort with working in and contributing to a fast-paced, team environment.
Desire and capacity to take full ownership of work tracks and mentor more junior staff.

 
The Weber Shandwick Collective recognizes that your health and wellbeing are a priority. This is why we offer a full suite of benefits including:

Medical
Dental
Vision
401k (with employer match)
Tuition Reimbursement
Juice Money - $60 monthly reimbursement to be used towards purchases that nourish your health, mind, body, and soul
MyDays – Flexible holiday schedules 
Short-Term Disability 
Paid Employee Family Leave 
Family Building Benefit
Weber Shandwick is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Weber Shandwick recruits qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, age, ethnic or national origin, protected veteran status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status or citizenship status.


#LI-MA1 We make our careers website accessible to any and all users. If you need an accommodation to participate in the application process, please contact us at JobAppAccommodation@ipgdxtra.com. This email address is not for general employment inquiries or vendors; rather it is strictly for applicants who require special assistance accessing our employment website. Due to volume, messages sent to this email address that are not related to an accommodation cannot be answered.

questions.description:
To submit this application you must agree to the IPG DXTRA eRecruiting Privacy Notice. At IPG DXTRA, we oversee several core award-winning agencies such as Weber Shandwick, Golin, Jack Morton, Octagon, DeVries and Momentum.

I also certify that the information contained on this form, my resume/C.V., any other attachments and any other information that I or anyone acting on my behalf provides to the Company during the hiring process is correct and complete. I understand that any misrepresentation or omission in this application will be cause for denial or termination of employment.

I understand that all employment offers are contingent based upon the results of employment and educational background checks. I agree to execute any consent forms necessary for the Company to conduct its lawful pre-employment checks. I hereby authorize the Company to conduct a criminal and/or credit history background check. I also release the Company and its employees, my prior employers and listed educational institutions from any and all liability in connection with any such contact or disclosures.

If hired, I agree to abide by all of the Company rules and regulations and I understand that if employed my employment is “at will”. By this, I understand that my employment can be terminated with or without cause and with or without notice at any time, at the option of myself or the Company.
